Sentencas: A Ni/scandia-stabilized zirconia (ScSZ) cermet anode was modified by coating with nano-sized gadolinium-doped ceria (GDC, Gd0.2Ce0.8O2) within the pores of the anode for a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM) were employed in the anode characterizations.
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC

Sentencas: Open circuit voltages (OCVs) increased from 1.027 to 1.078 V, and the maximum power densities increased from 238 to 825 MW/cm(2), as the operating temperature of a SOFC with 2.0 wt.%GDCcoated Ni/ScSZ anode was increased from 700 to 850 degrees C in humidified hydrogen.
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC

Sentencas: The coating of nano-sized Gdo(0.2)Ce(0.8)O(2) particle within the pores of the porous Ni/ScSZ anode significantly improved the performance of anode supported cell.
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) illustrated that the cell with Ni/ScSZ anode exhibited far greater impedances than the cell with 2.0 wt.%GDC-coated Ni/ScSZ anode.
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC

Sentencas: Consequently, 2.0 wt.%GDC-coated Ni/ScSZ anode could be used as a novel anode material for a SOFC due to better electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Performance of Ni/ScSZ cermet anode modified by coating with Gd0.2Ce0.8O2 for a SOFC
